snippet: If, in the aftermath of Donald Sterling’s punishment, we declare the issue dead and the bad guy vanquished, we will all miss a golden opportunity for a deeper exploration of racism.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column says remarks made by Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling, who was handed a lifetime ban for racist remarks he made, offer chance to examine racism in professional sports and beyond; says problem is less about words used in a private conversation and more about institutionalized bigotry expressed in action.
lead_paragraph: If, in the aftermath of Donald Sterling’s punishment, we declare the issue dead and the bad guy vanquished, we will all miss a golden opportunity for a deeper exploration of racism.

headline.seo: Sterling’s Remarks Offer Chance to Examine Racism
headline.main: A Verdict on Comments, but the Conversation Isn’t Over
headline.print_headline: A Verdict on Comments, but the Conversation Isn’t Over
